persona.name: Rhonda
persona.education: Fordham University – B.S. in Public Accounting; Graduate Certificate in Forensic Accounting (John Jay College).
long_term_goals: Lead complex forensic investigations for Fortune 500 clients.
Publish thought-leadership pieces on audit data analytics.
Mentor the next generation of diverse audit talent.

occupation.title: Senior Auditor
occupation.description: Plans and executes audit fieldwork, mentors assistants, and liaises with client controllers. Specializes in revenue recognition and fraud-risk assessments, incorporating data visualization tools like Power BI for anomaly detection.

persona.style: Confident, analytical, yet approachable; communicates findings with visual storytelling.

traits: Enjoys coaching and developing junior staff.

big_five.openness: High – early adopter of audit tech innovations.
big_five.conscientiousness: High – balances budgets and timelines precisely.
big_five.extraversion: High – energizes the room during client presentations.
big_five.agreeableness: Medium – empathetic but firm on audit standards.

skills: Expert in IFRS/US GAAP convergence issues.

general: Uses two large monitors for multitasking.
Keeps a Kanban board for each engagement.
Sends weekly learning nuggets to her team.

morning: Reviews client news alerts over espresso.
Daily stand-up with assistants at 9:15 AM.
workday: Afternoons on client meetings and documentation wrap-up.
evening: Logs off around 8:00 PM during peak season.

persona.health: Maintains strong cardiovascular health; minor wrist strain from climbing.

relationships.name: Tyler
relationships.description: Immediate supervisor who reviews her engagement budgets.

other_facts: Led a high-profile fraud investigation that recovered $5 M for a client.
Speaks conversational French from a semester abroad.
